Poland: ~100-200 (estimate based on number of search results for "evaluation", tempered by proportion of results on randomly selected pages that are not evaluations
Portugal: 300-400 (based on reports per page times number of pages, plus estimate on separate evaluation since relocation of publication
Sweden: ~650 (based on results per pages times number of pages)

Canada: General public services, economic affairs, housing, education, social protection
Costa Rica: Seems to be all excluding defence
Ireland: health, environmental, general public services, education, economics, defence
Lithuania: general public services; health; economic affairs; education; recreation, culture and religion; social protection; public order and safety
Poland: Health, general public services, economic affairs, education, environmental protection, social protection
Spain: General public services, social protection, housing and community amenities, health, environmental protection, education, recreation culture and religion, economic affairs
Finland: Decentralised: Economic Development, Foreign affairs, Education

Turkey: Announcements, e.g..: Weekly Developments and General Outlook in Turkish Economy

Australia: No discontinuity, but very limited before 2017. Only COFOG policy area which is less clear is housing, but this may come under "Built Environment" and "Social Issues"; volumes calculated by adding all of the number of evaluations from each year filter
Austria: Discontinuity: no evaluations in 2014. There are two decentralised portals. One focusing on development and research and technology evaluations (Economic Affairs COFOG category); volumes counting only devlopment
Belgium: Discontinuity: No reports for 2007, 2015 or after 2024. Two decentralised portals. The first is the Special Evaluation Office (SEO) operating as part of the FBS Foreign Affairs website (looking at development). The second is run by the Minsitry for Social Integration (SPP), which largely focuses on social protection. It features policy reports and some evaluations, although it is not specifically dedicated to eveluations.
Canada: The portal is run by the department of Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC)
Chile: volume: total number of reports without any year filter on
Czechia: This evaluation page is part of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Website and only covers Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Aid policies
Denmark: Published by Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Estonia: This country does not have a portal for publishing government evaluation reports
France: Published by the High Commission of Strategy and Planning
Greece: This country does not publish evaluaiton reports
Hungary: This country does not publish evaluation reports
Iceland: Published by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Italy: each year reports evaluate the previous year; external links to: The Italian Anticorruption Authority, National agency for the evaluation of universities and research (ANVUR), National Agency for Regional Health Services (AGENAS)
Japan: each year reports evaluate the previous year;also a section about their research into policy evaluation practices in other countries
Latvia: This country does not publish evaluation reports
Luxembourg: case-based, only exists for Directorate for Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Affairs; years excluding NGO evaluations
Mexico: CONEVAL is in dissolution process as a department; The Budget Transparency portal from The Ministry of Finance and Public Credit is more like audits; certain years only have some documents not all, e.g., Evaluaion Reports on Social Development Policy has many years missing
The Netherlands: Discontinutiy: 1974-1979. Volume of evaluations: This has been calculated by multiplying the average numver of evaluations on each page (10) by the number of pages (81) minus the number of spending reviews (~300).
New Zealand: Published by Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade
Poland: Not same evaluations available year-to-year. Primarily aid-focused
Portugal: Evaluation study database for 2010-2019, transition to more tailored content in 2022. News, analysis notes, methodological guides, diverse resources etc...
United Kingdom: Inconsistent but backlog of evaluations added since release, discontinuities possible but unlikely with scale.
Finland: Published by Ministry of Foreign Affairs
Israel: under 'reports' in the Israeli government website publication database. search for reports in the Israeli government website publication database
Slovenia: This country does not publish evaluation reports
Turkey: commision reports for the next 5-year plan reviews previous one --> omitted the first 5-year plan
Germany: There is no tool to search by date/year, so discontinuity is unknown. Although DEval has a number of evaluation categories, they all fall under development cooperation

Ireland: yes -- Irish Governmnet Economic and Evaluation Service (IGEES) Publications
Lithuania: yes, but not just policy evaluation

Czechia: Ministries (only exist for Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Ministry of Finance)
Iceland: Part of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs Website
Luxembourg: only in the Directorate for Development Cooperation and Humanitarian Affairs
United States: Each department responsible for own evaluations
Finland: Each department publishes its own evaluations
Israel: in the publication database in gov.il

Germany: Yes (note, DEval is mandated by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ))

Australia: There is an "Easy English/ Eassy Read" Filter in the collection browzing page
Canada: Large print, braille, MP3 (audio), e-text and DAISY formats are available for most reports, but you need to request them
Japan: voiceover -- but not working; language options
Lithuania: font size; high contrast; B&W mode;  diable photos
The Netherlands: It has an accesibility link and statement proving that it passes regulatory requirements
Sweden: Recent reports available in both HTML and accessible PDF form
United Kingdom:
change colours, contrast levels and fonts
zoom in up to 400% without the text spilling off the screen
navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)

The Netherlands: On the portal explanation and toolbox pages

Italy: layout to crowded: font too small

Japan: visualisation tools for database on spending and budget by departments
The Netherlands: On the portal explanation and toolbox pages

Australia: 7,607 published from 2022 onwards. Mulptiple publications each month
Austria: Tend to be around yearly, sometimes slightly more regular
The Netherlands: Very high frequency (rolling, as soon as evaluations announced)

Australia: Very good, but could benefit from larger text option and interactive features. Excellent “evaluation toolkit” section, explaining what evaluations are; limited accessibility tools
Austria: The ADA (Development) portal is in association with the BMEIA (Austrian Foreign Office) (i.e. many reports are carried out together), but they have separate websites. Search function: There is one for website homepage, but not for the actual evaluation reports page. Summary available:  but not all - predominantely recent publications. Reports from 2017 onwards have a clear options for each report: evaluation brief, main report, annexes, executive summary, infographic and management response
Belgium: Search function: There is one for website homepage, but not for the actual evaluation reports page.
Canada: Decentralised, but the standards set for reports are centralised
Costa Rica: Navigation is challenging. Summaries: present, but they are very brief.
Czechia: Only lists reports in order of date published
Japan: central portal hosts all evaluations but also redirects to each ministry hosting specific policy area evaluations
Mexico: CONEVAL (National Council for the Evaluation of Social Development Policy): only for social policies
The Netherlands: Portal includes filter for the status of a report (announced, completed, cancelled, postponed, in progress)
Poland: All evaluations accessible through central government website under relevant ministry. Search required. Consistency indeterminable.
Portugal: Very well presented, highly intuitive site to use and navigate. Frequency varies, but relatively high.
Sweden: Fully navigable and well presented site with highly transparent and detailed explanations. Up to ~20 reports a year
Switzerland: Full, well navigable database but nothing in the way of extra presentation or features
United Kingdom: Full, well navigable database but nothing in the way of extra presentation or features
United States: Page linking to each department's annual evidence plan and evaluation policies
South Korea: Portal is centralized but evaluations are conducted by separate ministries

Sweden: The Swedish Agency for Public Management
Switzerland: Search for evaluations in the Aramis database
